title: 115_s351
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Student Achievement Information Act of 2017" requires consumer information on completion or graduation times. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require transparency in college tuition by providing completion or graduation rates for undergraduate students in programs of study 4 years or longer. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require transparency in college tuition by providing completion or graduation rates for undergraduate students in programs of study 4 years or longer. The institution must report the percentages of students who obtain a degree or certificate within specified timeframes. The Higher Education Act of 1965 requires institutions to report completion or graduation rates for undergraduate programs. Students must obtain a degree within specified timeframes, including normal time, 150% of normal time, and 200% of normal time for program completion. Programs less than 4 years have different completion timeframes. For programs less than 4 years, institutions must report the percentages of first-time, full-time, and part-time undergraduate students who obtain a degree or certificate within specified completion timeframes. The institution must report the percentages of non-first-time, full-time, and part-time undergraduate students who obtain a degree or certificate within specified completion timeframes. The institution must report completion or graduation times for students, including normal time, 150% of normal time, and 300% of normal time. The Secretary must display these percentages consistently and prominently. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include completion or graduation rates for students as part of the institutional and financial assistance information.
